data.title: What an unexpected Surprise!
data.text:
My wife and I have been meaning to try Francoli's since they moved to Orange.  We did last night and found one of the best Italian restaurants we have ever visited.  I had the cioppino ( which I have had in innumerable restaurants) and found it to be as good or better than the best I have ever had.  I can not wait to return for a second opportunity to indulge in that again.

Pricey but great!

data.title: Food excellent, Service from our Waiter could have been better
data.text: We (4 of us) came here on Labor Day and had only a 15 minute wait before we were seated in their small outside patio. The food (butternut ravioli; sword fish; turkey salad; shrimp pasta) was all excellent. The serving sizes were smaller than most other restaurants. I was able to eat my entire dinner where as I share with my husband or take home half of my meal as a usual occurrence  Our waiter, however, seemed very much preoccupied and we had a hard time having him give us all a chance to order coffee or drinks. We also had trouble just trying to get a dessert menu. Putting him aside, .the rest of the evening was pleasant, with live music, regional foods to buy and meals that excelled in presentation and flavors.

data.title: Authentic, Fresh, & Great Italian Wines
data.text:
Consistently delicious gourmet Italian restaurant situated in historic Orange at the circle. 

Al fresco dining, quaint bar, or intimate dining room with imported Morano custom chandeliers.  

Enjoy fantastic Italian imported wines and a well stocked bar.

data.title: Dinner
data.text: The one thing about good pasta is it's al dente.  I ordered Francoli's gnocchi and it was mush.  Chef Boyardee in a can would have been better and I could have saved paying their high prices.

data.title: Nice restaurant in Orange
data.text: Really good italian restaurant. Tried a couple of the daily specials and a couple of dishes off of their regular menu and they were all good. Nice keyboard player in the corner. Good wine list and fabulous desserts. Service was attentive. Will most certainly come back next time I'm near Orange.

data.title: Perfect italian food and wine
data.text:
Fantastic food and vine. So good food and everything was perfect!!! 
Everybody in the restaurant was so friendly and proffesional. We will be back!

data.title: Nice restaurant near the Circle
data.text: We had a very good meal with interesting items on the menu.  All of which were good.  Really good wine selections, and good assistance with pairings.  The desserts were especially nice.  We had too many items to list but they were all enjoyable.  Service was excellent.

data.title: NIce night out near Disneyland
data.text: Had an excellent Italian meal complete with wine. The service was excellent and the location is on the circle in Orange. Try the smoked salmon appetizer.

data.title: Great restaurant
data.text: Went there for lunch & had rock fish & excellent vegetables & wonderful wine. Would go back again. No reservations needed. Great ambience

data.title: Loved sitting in the corner window sit having great food, great service and wine.
data.text: Our family of 7 all tried something different, and we all enjoyed our entrees. We all sampled each others and we thought it was very good. The service was very good, and the ambiance of our table added to the experience. The portions were more fair for the price than I had been told.  We'd go back again.

data.title: Amazing bresaola!  Have to eat that!
data.text: Really good food at this cute little restaurant on a fun corner of the city.  I would recommend this place and definitely eat the bresaola.  Do not get the mushroom risotto.  That was a fail.  Other than that, really great meal!

data.title: A Real Taste of Italy
data.text: Not since dining at some of the best places in the Emilia Romagna region of Italy, have my wife and I experienced such authentic Italian food. Why? Because where else do you see on any menu that they serve fresh pasta imported from Pisa, Italy? The restaurant is located on the Orange traffic circle, so it just reeks of a small town vibe. The staff is well trained and attentive and the preparation of everything we had was top notch, flavorful and comforting. We were especially impressed that, as evidence that they use only the best ingredients, they sell some of the best olive oils you can find in Italy and one of the few places we've found that actually has authentic, Modena-made balsamic vinegar (it's $215 for 100ml!!).

data.title: Great service and food at Francoli
data.text: Took the Orangefoodtour.com and one of the stops was Francoli's. Being Italian and a good Italian cook I paid close attention to this part of the tour. The staff was so inviting and well versed on the different regions of Italy and how different the food is from town to town. My wife and I returned to Francoli's after the tour was over and checking out the local shops. The staff was just as great as when we were on the tour. The food was also good. Now they say the Lazagna is the best ever, Being Italian and making the best Lazagna ever I was skeptical, well it was very good, different than mine so we both can be the best ever!!! This place deserves the 5 star rating for the staff and food alike. I highly recommend having lunch or dinner here. We will be back.

data.title: Relaxing place to linger with great food and drink
data.text: We try to come here whenever we visit our son at Chapman University.  The location is charming, the service is always great.  The lasagne is to die for!  This is a great place for a special occasion, very romantic.  There is usually live music but the volume is not too loud and you can still carry on a conversation.  Not a big place so plan ahead.

data.title: Finally a True Northern Italian Restaurant
data.text:
Found a wonderful gem in the circle of Orange California.  We have been looking for an Italian Restaurant in our area that honed in on dishes from Northern Italy. The food was fantastic.  The home made ravioli melted in your mouth.  The short rib filling was delicious and the pasta dough paper thin.  Risotto, which was on the Special menu, was also perfect.  Not too creamy and not too dry.  I hear the Lasagna with the bechamel sauce is the favorite.  We also were very impressed with the raw beef carpaccio.  It's noisy but we found it to be a fun atmosphere. It had a real bistro feeling to it.  Waiters were very attentive and helpful.
If going out on the week end, be there early as there are no reservations and it fills up fast.  If you love Italian food that's made in the style of Piedmont, give it a try.

data.title: WONDERFUL EXPERIENCE
data.text: My husband and I have eaten at Francoli two times. Its such a beautiful restaurant and the staff are so hospitable and kind. The food is great too. Salads are devine, pasta dishes are also very good. Very busy, reservations would be a plus.

data.title: Horrible, disrespectful, condescending
data.text: This restaurant does not have the "personalized service" as highlighted above. Instead, the owner, Alberto, condones the rudeness and disrespect his staff espresses to the customers. Empty and false promises are consistently given from this establishment. When caught in that dishonesty, they then get defensive and disrespectful. We were recently subjected to their verbal abuse when they ultimately forgot to write our name down on the list waiting for a table. Instead of making it right and apologizing, we were met with attitude and distain from the hostess. Customer service is not even remotely in their vocabulary. No matter how decent the food is, the service kills the mood and any desire to return.

data.title: A Complete Italian Dining Experience
data.text: The ambience was terrific - we loved the singer!  The food was delicious and plentiful.  We ordered appetizers, entrees, wine, and a dessert to split.  The only negative was my friend did not enjoy her cocktail, said it tasted very watered down.

data.title: Great spot in Orange
data.text:
Francoli is situated opposite the Orange Circle, so it's easy to find .It has a small outside patio where we ate and the inside is really well designed with a half moon shaped bar, nice tables and a wall of Italian wines at one end.
The food was  a nice take on Northern Italian cuisine , simple but tasteful as we would expect. The lunch salad my wife had included walnut and blue cheese but with the addition of really fresh pear slices which was a nice touch. 
The wines are reasonably priced and the list is quite extensive. 
The service was perhaps the best we've had since travelling in California, attentive, knowledgeable and on time. Because of the excellent service the meal just flowed , as it should.
Definitely worth a return visit but we'll sit inside as the traffic noise was higher than normal.

data.title: An Upscale Italian Cafe Experience
data.text: My wife and I like to eat at Francoli when we want a great piece of fish and a good bottle of wine. They have both along with friendly waiters and a nice outside view of the plaza. Try sipping wine at the wine bar and having your meal there too. Nice
